noun.name: knife
noun.discription: a sharp-edged tool used for cutting

object1.name: scissors
object1.discription: in parallel with 'knife', is a tool with two blades connected by a hinge, used for cutting paper or fabric

object2.name: saw
object2.discription: in parallel with 'knife', is a tool with a serrated blade used for cutting wood or metal

object3.name: hammer
object3.discription: in parallel with 'knife', is a tool with a heavy head used for driving nails or breaking objects

object4.name: pliers
object4.discription: in parallel with 'knife', is a tool with jaws used for gripping, bending, or cutting wire

object5.name: wrench
object5.discription: in parallel with 'knife', is a tool with a handle and a jawed head used for turning nuts or bolts

object6.name: drill
object6.discription: in parallel with 'knife', is a tool with a rotating cutting bit used for making holes in various materials

object7.name: tweezers
object7.discription: in parallel with 'knife', is a tool with two thin arms joined at one end, used for picking up small objects

object8.name: chisel
object8.discription: in parallel with 'knife', is a tool with a sharp edge used for carving or cutting hard materials
